citation.article-title: Pedobacter caeni sp. nov., a novel species isolated from a nitrifying inoculum
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pedobacter caeni sp. nov.
Pedobacter caeni (ca.e′ni. L. gen. neut. n. caeni of sludge).
After 48 h incubation at 28 °C on TSA and NA, colonies are 0·5–8 mm, smooth, convex, round, slimy, initially creamy white, turning to yellow when ageing.
Cells are rod-shaped (0·5–1 μm wide and 3–10 μm long), Gram-negative, non-spore-forming.
Good growth is obtained after incubation for 48 h at 28 °C on TSA and NA; very slow growth occurs at 37 °C.

Can be differentiated from the type strains of its closest phylogenetic neighbours, P. heparinus LMG 4024T and P. africanus LMG 10353T, by its ability to assimilate l-xylose, arbutin, d-raffinose and starch, by its inability to assimilate d-xylose, l-rhamnose and d-turanose and by the absence of the enzymes naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
The type strain, LMG 22862T (=DSM 16990T), was isolated from a commercial nitrifying inoculum in Gent, Belgium.
